Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ هَلَاكٌ
enWisdom: Anxiety is [a cause of] destruction

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ مَنْقَصَةٌ
enWisdom: Agitation is degradation

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ مِنْ أَعْوَانِ الزَّمَانِ
enWisdom: Anxiety is one of the assistants of the [difficult] time

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ يُعَظِّمُ الْمِحْنَةَ
enWisdom: Anxiety magnifies the calamity

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ أَتْعَبُ مِنَ الصَّبْرِ
enWisdom: Anxiety is more exhausting than patience

Wisdom: الْحُزْنُ وَالْجَزَعُ لَا يَرُدَّانِ الْفَائِتَ
enWisdom: Sorrow and anxiety do not bring back what has been lost

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ عِنْدَ الْبَلَاءِ مِنْ تَمَامِ الْمِحْنَةِ
enWisdom: Anxiety during hardship completes [and enhances] the calamity

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ عِنْدَ الْمُصِيبَةِ أَشَدُّ مِنَ الْمُصِيبَةِ
enWisdom: Anxiety during adversity is severer than the adversity itself

Wisdom: الْمُصِيبَةُ وَاحِدَةٌ وَإِنْ جَزِعْتَ صَارَتِ [كَانَتِ‏] اثْنَتَيْنِ
enWisdom: The adversity is one, but if you become anxious it becomes twofold

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ لَا يَدْفَعُ الْقَدَرَ وَلَكِنْ يُحْبِطُ الْأَجْرَ
enWisdom: Anxiety does not ward off destiny, rather it blocks recompense

Wisdom: الْجَزَعُ [الْفَزَعُ‏] عِنْدَ الْمُصِيبَةِ يَزِيدُهَا وَالصَّبْرُ عَلَيْهَا يُبِيدُهَا
enWisdom: Anxiety during adversity increases it whereas patience ends it

Wisdom: اغْلِبُوا الْجَزَعَ بِالصَّبْرِ فَإِنَّ الْجَزَعَ يُحْبِطُ الْأَجْرَ وَيُعْظِمُ الْفَجِيعَةَ
enWisdom: Overcome anxiety with patience, for anxiety voids recompense and magnifies the calamity

Wisdom: إِنْ كُنْتَ جَازِعاً عَلَى كُلِّ مَا يَفْلُتُ مِنْ يَدَيْكَ فَاجْزَعْ عَلَى مَا لَمْ يَصِلْ إِلَيْكَ
enWisdom: If you are [one who gets] anxious about all that has escaped from your hands, then be anxious about what has not reached you

Wisdom: بِكَثْرَةِ الْجَزَعِ تَعْظُمُ الْفَجِيعَةُ
enWisdom: With excessive anxiety, the calamity is magnified

Wisdom: لَيْسَ مَعَ الْجَزَعِ مَثُوبَةٌ
enWisdom: There is no recompense with anxiety

Wisdom: مَنْ جَزَعَ عَظُمَتْ مُصِيبَتُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever becomes anxious, his adversity increases

Wisdom: مَنْ مَلَكَهُ الْجَزَعُ حُرِمَ فَضِيلَةَ الصَّبْرِ
enWisdom: One who is overcome by anxiety is deprived of the merit of patience

Wisdom: مَنْ ضَرَبَ يَدَهُ عَلَى فَخِذِهِ عِنْدَ مُصِيبَةٍ فَقَدْ أَحْبَطَ أَجْرَهُ
enWisdom: One who hits his hand on his thigh in times of hardship has nullified his reward

Wisdom: مَنْ أَصْبَحَ يَشْكُو مُصِيبَةً نَزَلَتْ بِهِ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُو رَبَّهُ
enWisdom: One who starts complaining about the hardship that has befallen him is actually only complaining against his Lord

Wisdom: مَنْ كَشَفَ ضُرَّهُ لِلنَّاسِ عَذَّبَ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: One who discloses his suffering to the people torments himself

Wisdom: مَنْ شَكَا ضُرَّهُ إِلَى مُؤْمِنٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا شَكَا اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever complains of his distress to a believer, it is as if he has complained to Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: مَنْ جَزَعَ فَنَفْسَهُ عَذَّبَ وَأَمْرَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ أَضَاعَ وَثَوَابَهُ بَاعَ
enWisdom: One who becomes anxious has tormented himself, neglected the command of Allah, the Glorified, and sold off his reward

Wisdom: لَا تَجْزَعُوا مِنْ قَلِيلِ مَا أَكْرَهَكُمْ فَيُوقِعَكُمْ ذَلِكَ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِمَّا تَكْرَهُونَ
enWisdom: Do not get anxious in the [face of] little that you dislike for it will put you in a lot of what you dislike

Wisdom: لَا يَجْتَمِعُ الصَّبْرُ وَالْجَزَعُ
enWisdom: Patience and anxiety do not go together
